captions.text:
one day my neighbor caught me by
surprise

and asked me to tell a story that he
said would illustrate the ethics of your religion
a story that he said would persuade me and help me appreciate Islam
the question completely startled me
But I quickly recalled a famous story about an Imam in London
Several years ago an Imam moved to London
He used to take the same bus every single day with the same driver To a stop near his mosque
One day as he was riding He paid the bus fare and sat down

realizing that the driver
had mistakenly given him an additional 40 pence
When the Imam sat down he considered keeping the extra change since it was insignificant amount anyway
But as he was departing, he felt guilty

and handed the 40 pants back to the
driver
and said: "Sir, I think you gave me too much change."
The driver smiled and said:
Aren't you the new Imam in this area?
You know lately I've actually been thinking about stopping by your mosque and learning about Islam
before I did that I wanted to see
what you would do if I gave you extra change
As the Imam stepped off of the bus he was so shaken by the incident

that he grabbed the pole looked up to
the sky and cried out :
"O Allah, I almost sold Islam for forty pence!"
My neighbor said: let’s face it though
if it was a significant amount of money the imam would’ve kept it
I insisted that this was the inherent nature of the Muslim

and he would have given it back even if
it was forty thousand pounds

but he shook his head in disapproval
indicating he wasn’t impressed

I didn't think that my neighbor thought
much of the Imam story
I thought he'd probably forgotten about it by the next day
Little did I know that just as the bus driver tested the Imam
my neighbor wanted to test me
me by leaving a bag of a ton of money in the parking garage
I had no clue he was watching
I must admit it was a whole lot of money
But I really didn’t think twice about it

I acted in accordance with what my
conscience and religion commanded me to do
knowing that if the Prophet (pbuh) was in my shoes, he would've done the same.
I had to find a way to get it back to its owner

I posted signs I made calls but got
absolutely no response

people must have thought it was some
kind of scam
My Neighbor says to me : Muslims can't be tempted huh?
I knew you'd given in and spend the money
so I told them what happened
I’m not here to defend myself , i said
But what I’d really like to do is teach you what our Prophet Mohammad (PBUH) taught us
I gave him the donation receipt from the charity towhich I donated the money

and informed him that the car I was
driving was actually my uncle's car
which I was borrowing because my car had to be fixed
So then I asked him: Have you filed your taxes for this year yet?
I think we should get this receipt to your CPA
Imagine having a nasty neighbor that verbally abuses you in every conceivable way
But despite all of that abuse
when he travels or has to find someone to watch his precious valuables
he trusts no one more than you
because he knows your integrity
that was our Prophet Mohammed peace be upon

as we walked back home that day my
neighbor thanked me for the time we spent together

telling me I completely
changed his perception of Islam and its prophet

I then shared with him that it was our
prophet who said :
honor the trust in those who give it to you
and do not betray the one who betrays you.
what caught my attention is that
my neighbor was willing to test me with such a huge amount of money
just to test my decency as a Muslim
I hope that the Prophet Mohammad (PBUH) would’ve been proud of how I responded
RasulAllah
We testify that you have fulfilled your trust and conveyed to us the message
We only pray that we can continue to convey on your behalf, without betraying your trust.
